verses.kjv: Then said the LORD unto me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my mind could not be toward this people: cast them out of my sight, and let them go forth.
verses.ct: Then the LORD said to me, "Even if Moses and Samuel were standing in my presence pleading for them, my heart would not go out to this people. Send them away from my presence. Let them leave."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, if they say unto thee, Whither shall we go forth? then thou shalt tell them, Thus saith the LORD; Such as are for death, to death; and such as are for the sword, to the sword; and such as are for the famine, to the famine; and such as are for the captivity, to the captivity.
verses.ct: If they ask you, 'Where should we go?' tell them this is what the LORD says: Those destined for death will go to death. Those destined for the sword will go to the sword. Those destined for famine will go to famine. Those destined for captivity will go to captivity.

verses.kjv: And I will appoint over them four kinds, saith the LORD: the sword to slay, and the dogs to tear, and the fowls of the heaven, and the beasts of the earth, to devour and destroy.
verses.ct: "I will assign 4 kinds of destruction against them," declares the LORD. "The sword to kill, dogs to drag away the bodies, birds of the heavens to feed on them, and wild animals to consume and destroy what remains."

verses.kjv: And I will cause them to be removed into all kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah king of Judah, for that which he did in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: "I will make them an object of horror to every kingdom on earth because of what Manasseh son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, did in Jerusalem."

verses.kjv: For who shall have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem? or who shall bemoan thee? or who shall go aside to ask how thou doest?
verses.ct: "Who will feel sorry for you, Jerusalem? Who will mourn for you? Who will even stop to ask how you are doing?"

verses.kjv: Thou hast forsaken me, saith the LORD, thou art gone backward: therefore will I stretch out my hand against thee, and destroy thee; I am weary with repenting.
verses.ct: "You have abandoned me," declares the LORD. "You keep pulling further away. So I will raise my hand against you and destroy you. I am tired of holding back."

verses.kjv: And I will fan them with a fan in the gates of the land; I will bereave them of children, I will destroy my people, since they return not from their ways.
verses.ct: "I will scatter them like grain winnowed at the gates of the land. I will take their children from them. I will destroy my people, because they refuse to turn from their ways."

verses.kjv: Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas: I have brought upon them against the mother of the young men a spoiler at noonday: I have caused him to fall upon it suddenly, and terrors upon the city.
verses.ct: "I have made their widows more numerous than the sand of the seas. Against the mothers of young men I have sent a destroyer at midday. I brought sudden anguish and terror crashing down on them."

verses.kjv: She that hath borne seven languisheth: she hath given up the ghost; her sun is gone down while it was yet day: she hath been ashamed and confounded: and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "The mother who gave birth to 7 sons grows faint. She has taken her last breath. Her sun has set while it was still daytime. She is disgraced and humiliated. As for the survivors, I will hand them over to the sword of their enemies," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Woe is me, my mother, that thou hast borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have neither lent on usury, nor men have lent to me on usury; yet every one of them doth curse me.
verses.ct: How terrible for me, my mother, that you gave birth to me — a man who brings conflict and opposition to the whole land! I haven't lent money at interest, and no one has lent to me at interest, yet everyone curses me.

verses.kjv: The LORD said, Verily it shall be well with thy remnant; verily I will cause the enemy to entreat thee well in the time of evil and in the time of affliction.
verses.ct: The LORD said, "Truly, I will preserve a remnant of yours. Truly, I will make your enemies plead with you in times of disaster and distress."

verses.kjv: Shall iron break the northern iron and the steel?
verses.ct: Can anyone shatter iron — iron from the north reinforced with bronze?

verses.kjv: Thy substance and thy treasures will I give to the spoil without price, and that for all thy sins, even in all thy borders.
verses.ct: "Your wealth and your treasures I will hand over as plunder, without any payment in return, because of all your sins throughout your territory."

verses.kjv: And I will make thee to pass with thine enemies into a land which thou knowest not: for a fire is kindled in mine anger, which shall burn upon you.
verses.ct: "I will send you with your enemies into a land you have never known, because a fire has been ignited by my anger, and it will burn against you."

verses.kjv: O LORD, thou knowest: remember me, and visit me, and revenge me of my persecutors; take me not away in thy longsuffering: know that for thy sake I have suffered rebuke.
verses.ct: LORD, you understand my situation. Remember me and come to my aid. Take revenge on those who persecute me. Don't let your patience with them be the end of me. Recognize that I endure insults because of you.

verses.kjv: Thy words were found, and I did eat them; and thy word was unto me the joy and rejoicing of mine heart: for I am called by thy name, O LORD God of hosts.
verses.ct: When your words came to me, I devoured them. Your words became my deepest joy and delight, because I carry your name, LORD God of Armies.

verses.kjv: I sat not in the assembly of the mockers, nor rejoiced; I sat alone because of thy hand: for thou hast filled me with indignation.
verses.ct: I never sat among those who mock and celebrated with them. Because of your hand on me, I sat alone, since you filled me with your righteous anger.

verses.kjv: Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, which refuseth to be healed? wilt thou be altogether unto me as a liar, and as waters that fail?
verses.ct: Why does my pain never end? Why is my wound beyond healing, refusing to get better? Will you be like a stream that dries up and disappoints — like water that cannot be relied on?

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD, If thou return, then will I bring thee again, and thou shalt stand before me: and if thou take forth the precious from the vile, thou shalt be as my mouth: let them return unto thee; but return not thou unto them.
verses.ct: So this is what the LORD says: "If you come back to me, I will restore you, and you will serve in my presence. If you speak what is worthwhile instead of what is worthless, you will be my spokesman. Let the people turn to you, but don't lower yourself to their level."

verses.kjv: And I will make thee unto this people a fenced brasen wall: and they shall fight against thee, but they shall not prevail against thee: for I am with thee to save thee and to deliver thee, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "I will make you like a fortified wall of bronze to this people. They will fight against you, but they will not overpower you, because I am with you to rescue and save you," declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked, and I will redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible.
verses.ct: "I will rescue you from the grip of the wicked, and I will free you from the clutches of the ruthless."
